div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON.
SAM PLASTINO vs. HENRY M. WHITE, United States Commissioner of Immigration, at Seattle, Washington. 3393 ORDER OF WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.

On reading and considering the petition of Sam Plastino, filed herein, whereby it appears that he is illegally imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by Henry M. White, United States Commissioner of Immigration, at Seattle, Washington, it appearing to the court that a writ of habeas corpus ought to issue. --

NOW, THEREFORE, IT IS ORDERED That a writ of habeas corpus issue out of and under the seal of this court, directed to the said Henry M. White, United States Commissioner of Immigration, at Seattle, Washington, commanding him to have the body of the said Sam Plastino before me in the court room of this court on the 5th day of August, 1916, at the hour of ten o'clock A.M., to do and receive what shall be considered concerning the said Sam Plastino, together with the time and cause of his detention, and that the said Henry m. White, United States Commissioner as aforesaid, have then and there the said writ.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED That the said Sam Plastino may be admitted to bail in the sum of $1000.00 pending the proceedings thereon.
IN THE SUPERIORDistrictCOURT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTONUnited States
In and for W District of Washington
Sam Plasino, Plaintiff VS. Henry M. White United States Commissioner, Defendant.
Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus
FILED IN THE U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, Northern Division AUG 3-1916 FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By Ed M Lakin Deputy
TOLMAN & KING ATTORNEYS AT LAW 1112 Old National Bank BLDG SPOKANE, WASHINGTON
